On Nov 23, 2007, at 11:22 PM, Berend de Boer wrote:

> If you do this, you can track a not yet logged in user perfectly
> fine. No url rewriting needed. No cookies needed.

For solving the problem you mention - maintaining information about  
unauthenticated visitors - cookies seem like a good solution: if the  
user has disabled them, everything will still work; the browser sends  
them along automatically; URLs don't need to change; JavaScript  
doesn't need to be enabled.

I don't see "no cookies" as a goal in itself. What are the benefits of  
your approach over using them?

Stefan
